author: Staff Reporter
text:
Complaint was sent to Child Welfare Committee

A 16-year-old girl was sexually abused by a 46-year-old sweeper of Pavendar Bharathidasan Government High School.

On March 18, Childline had forwarded a complaint to the Child Welfare Committee (CWC) regarding the abuse of a minor girl. A well-wisher had informed that she and a few other girls were abused by the school sweeper. Accordingly, the minor girl was produced before the CWC along with her parents and a complaint was filed. Subsequently, an FIR was registered at the Thirubhuvanai police station.

The victim was studying in the 11{+t}{+h}standard in the school and the sweeper was known to her. “Two weeks ago, the girl had arrived early to school when the sweeper was cleaning a classroom. He called her inside and sexually abused her,” said a CWC staff.

A case under Section 10 of the Prevention of Children from Sexual Offences Act was filed and the accused has been arrested.

This month alone, three child abuse cases have been reported in Puducherry.

A 14-year old boy was sexually abused by a woman home warden at a private. Children’s Home in Kirumampakkam for almost a year and an FIR was registered at Kirumampakkam police station under the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act on March 3. But, the accused has been left scot-free .

Recently, a three-and-half year old girl child was sexually abused by her father at Vaithikuppam.
title: School sweeper held for sexually abusing minor
